election_record.label: Virginia 1799 Speaker of the Senate

sub_unit.name: null
sub_unit.note: "On Tuesday last, the Senate of this commonwealth made a quorum and proceeded to the choice of a speaker when Mr. Ludwell Lee the former Speaker and Mr. Archibald Stewart of Augusta were nominated ~ On examing the ballots, they were found to stand as follow: For Mr. Stewart 9, Mr. Lee 5, Majority 4. As in the case of the House of Delegates, the republican candidate, the friend of freedom was elected." The Examiner (Richmond, VA). December 6, 1799.

"The Senate of Virginia, on the 5th instant, proceeded to the choice of a Speaker, when there appeared for Ludwell Lee the former Speaker, 5 votes, for Archibald Stewart of Augusta County, 9." The Centinel of Liberty, and George-town Advertiser (Georgetown, DC). December 13, 1799.

election_record.reference: The Centinel of Liberty, and George-town Advertiser (Georgetown, DC). December 13, 1799.
Leonard, Cynthia Miller, ed. The General Assembly of Virginia, July 30, 1619 - January 11, 1978: A Bicentennial Register of Members. Richmond: Virginia State Library, 1978.
